main event: A UFO sighting report near Lowry Air Force Base in Colorado on April 23, 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as saucer-shaped with a slight hump at the top center, appearing like a silver dollar or a silver bright star by naked eye.
Three Navy jets approached the object, and it climbed straight up or away at an estimated speed of 120-150 knots until out of sight.
The observer, a civilian aircraft maintenance inspector, reported few small cumulus clouds to the east and northeast, with the wind from the northwest.
It is noted that the observer had worked for the Air Force as an aircraft maintenance inspector since 1944 and stated that it was not a weather balloon.
Possibility exists that the object was a weather balloon released northwest of the area, traveling at approximately 30,000 feet in a southeast direction at a velocity of 45-120 knots.
sighted object: saucer-shaped object with a slight hump at the top center
